page.title: 07The Naked Man : an old oak.
page.content: The Naked Man is the site of a very old oak.Only a rather sad looking old stump about 3 or 4m high remains today.Local history tends to suggest that is about 400 hundred years old. The remains can be found in a map reference{246018}in this area.The origin of the name remains open to question a local legend.One story tells that a highwayman named {Mark {Way}was hanged on the tree,and there was a hill near by called{Mark Way {Hill,}close to the{A305}.Another story based on Kings map of 1759 does not support the gibbet story,but thinks it is a pun on{Mark Way,}the old Southampton - Dorset road.While the latter story may be more likely,the romance of the highwayman has more support in many peoples' eyes.
